lead_paragraph: The gunman said during the attack that he would strap explosives to four hostages and place them in the corners of the nightclub, the mayor said.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Orlando, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

headline.print_headline: Gunman Threatened to Strap Explosives to Hostages, Mayor Says
headline.main: Omar Mateen Told Police He’d Strap Bombs to Hostages, Orlando Mayor Says

snippet: The gunman said during the attack that he would strap explosives to four hostages and place them in the corners of the nightclub, the mayor said.
abstract: Orlando, Fla, Mayor Buddy Dyer says Omar Mateen, gunman responsible for mass shooting at nightclub, was reported to have set booby traps at club and had threatened to strap explosives to hostages; threat of explosives, none of which have so far been found, was complicating factor in decision making by police.
